head_office_address: 31A Ravens Rock Road, Sandyford Industrial Estate Dublin
eu_initiatives: Currently we are specifically interested in developments following the Proposals for veterinary medicine and proposals for veterinary medicated feed. We are also interested in all legislation that will impact on the manufacture, distribution, sale and supply of pesticides so have a particular interest in the review of Reg 1107 / 2009. We are also interested in discussions relating to Biocides, especially rodenticides, disinfectants and detergents.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: Members of ECPA and IFAH Europe and Health for Animals
goals__remit:
The Animal and Plant Health Association (APHA) is the representative body for manufacturers and sole distributors of animal health (veterinary medicines) and plant health (plant protection/agrochemical) products in Ireland. These industries play a vital role in providing high quality food at an economic cost whilst protecting the environment. 
 
APHA represents the interests of its members to Government, related industries and the general public. 
 
To ensure Ireland is represented at European level, APHA is a member of the ECPA (European Crop Protection Association) and the IFAH (International Federation for Animal Health).
